pull.title: build/doc: update bitcoin_config.h packages, release process
pull.body:
- Bump PACKAGE_VERSION and PACKAGE_STRING in `build_msvc/bitcoin_config.h` from 0.17 to 0.18 (follow-up to 48ed65b).

- Update `doc/release_process.md` (follow-up to e47dc4f), new version visible [here](https://github.com/jonatack/bitcoin/blob/bitcoin_config-and-release_process-updates/doc/release-process.md).

- Perhaps worth backporting the version updates to 0.18.0.

events.message:
doc: add bitcoin_config.h PACKAGE updates to release process

and reorganise the section and add relative url links.

Follow-up to e47dc4f.

events.body:
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16080/commits/8afca323e371a7a191d874928046d6bf2fbbe072

Looks like the descriptors were bumped in #15528.
I don't think it's necessary to backport release process changes.
Agree that this doesn't need backport

Thanks!

I mentioned backporting because in the tagged v0.18.0 release, PACKAGE_VERSION and PACKAGE_STRING in build_msvc/bitcoin_config.h are still set to 0.17 which may (or may not) cause issues for Visual Studio builds (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11526).

utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/8afca323e371a7a191d874928046d6bf2fbbe072.

Changing the PACKAGE* settings won't cause any problems for the msvc build. 

It's not strictly needed to update the build_msvc/bitcoin_config.h as part of the release process since the msvc build is for development/testing purposes only and neither it nor any artifacts produced from it are ever included in any bitcoin core downloads. But it also doesn't hurt and seems reasonable to keep them in sync.
